intro: Petrosavia amamiensis, commonly known as the Amami petrosavia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Amami Islands in Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, and it is notable for its limited distribution and conservation status. Due to habitat loss and limited genetic diversity, Petrosavia amamiensis is considered endangered.
